comments: Consider the set B(n) = {1,2,3,...n}. Let a(0) = 0. Then a(n) = Sum [ b(i)^2 - b(j)^2] for all i, j = 1 to n, b(i) belongs to B(n). E.g., a(3) = (3^2-1^2) + (3^2-2^2) + (2^2-1^2) = 16. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Jun 01 2001Partial sums of A016061. - _J. M. Bergot_, Jun 18 2013For n>=3, a(n-2) is the number of permutations of n symbols that 3-commute with an n-cycle (see A233440 for definition). - _Luis Manuel Rivera Mart√≠nez_, Feb 24 2014a(n) = the sum of all pairs with repetitions allowed drawn from the set of triangular numbers from A000217(0) to A000217(n).  This is similar to A027480 but uses triangular numbers instead of the integers.  Example for n=2: 0+1, 0+3, 1+1, 1+3, 3+3 gives sum of 16=a(2). - _J. M. Bergot_, Mar 23 2016
